Hola maquinola termodinámica fusionadora de protones cósmicos, como andas? Yo bien.
Voy a proceder a contarte como funciona el mambo de estos jueguitos, porque claramente si no lo hago yo, no lo hace nadie.
Los Zup! están hechos para sacar cromos y/o logros para usar las letritas. En mi caso, me re chupa un huevo los logros y las letritas para el perfil, ya que el mio ya esta cheto flama 10/10. Por ende, lo compré por los cromos para farmear guita.
Te preguntarás: ¿Por qué?. Porque si los agarrás de oferta (9pe por ej), sacas profit de 1 a 3 pesos o inclusive más, porque hay cromos que se venden a 7 pesos.
Ahora paso a comentarte:
- Zup! X/S/F y todos los que tienen letras, son los que tienen cromo de valor de +4 pesos.
- Zup! 1 2 3 4 y todos esos, valen 2.50 o 3.50 como mucho.

En mi perfil tenes todos los que farmee hasta ahora, empecé con $9 y terminé en $56,11. Podría haber hecho más pero se me terminó la oferta. Esto es sencillo, es comprar y bajar Idle Master que te farmea solo los cromos.
¿Es legal? SI. Es totalmente legal, no te banean por eso. La única forma de comerte un ban, es que abras un juego con el anticheat de Valve. Por las dudas te recomiendo que mientras farmees cromos, no abras ni juegues nada.

Si te sirvió esta pelotudes que leíste, agradeceme puteandome en mi perfil como varios orangutanes lo hacen (Los cuales aprecio porque me agregan y me invitan a jugar y me ayudan a salir de mi depresión causada por la falta de contacto con otro ser humano causada por la cuarentena, o en su defecto, me putean y me hacen reír con su creatividad).

Un abrazo capo, espero que te haya servido. Si queres aprender a farmear cromos o tener un perfil como el mio, en mi grupo lo explico todo

149397617.review:
Admittedly, I bought and 100%-ed this game for the achievements (and profile decoration).
It's a very simple puzzle game, reminiscent of Flash games of yore.
Going into this with the expectation of a simple puzzle game (with decorative achievements), I felt like I received exactly what I sought. That's why I recommend this game.
It's cheap, and I reckon most have purchased this game for reasons similar to mine.

However, looking at the gameplay objectively... It's a bit janky. If I had 0 interest in achievements/decorations/easy 100%s, I'd suggest looking elsewhere. It's definitely not a bad game, nor a chore to complete, but the Puzzle genre is well-established, and most games in this genre are pretty cheap.

Minor peeve: despite being graphically unimpressive, and the fact that there are ~21 games in this "series", none support Linux or macOS natively. I can't imagine it'd be hard to port this game (or this entire series). But it works well through Proton, for my Penguin Pals :)

149190668.review:
[h2]Zup Series: Achievements for Steam Design Enthusiasts with a Caveat[/h2]

The Zup series, including "Zup! 1-9," "F," "Q," "S," "X," "XS," "Zero," "Zero2," and "qop1-4," is undoubtedly a haven for achievement hunters and Steam profile designers. Each game in the series offers an assortment of colorful letters that can be used creatively to enhance your Steam profile, provided you're willing to put in the effort.

But here's the catch – some might not appreciate the fact that these achievements, when left uncompleted, can significantly lower your overall achievement completion average. To maintain your average, you'll need to meticulously play through every single level of every game, which can amount to hundreds or even thousands of achievements left untouched across the series.

In terms of gameplay, the Zup series starts off relatively easy, but there's a twist. Some levels are better suited for touch screens to nail the timing precisely. And let's not forget about the hidden achievements that require you to tap random parts of the screen on random levels. If you're aiming for that coveted 100%, be prepared to have YouTube at the ready and be ready to spend hours on end working your way through these games.

In summary, the Zup series is a unique achievement treasure for Steam design enthusiasts, but it comes with the caveat of potentially affecting your overall achievement completion average. The gameplay starts easy but can get tricky, especially when touch screens are involved. Hidden achievements add to the challenge, making full completion a test of patience and determination. If you're up for the task, dive in and design your Steam profile with a colorful array of achievements!

Disclaimer: I DO utilize AI to assist in crafting my reviews. Here's how it works:
1. Command: "Help me write a review for (game)"
2. Recommendation: I specify whether I do or don't recommend the title.
3. Tone: I choose a tone for the review (Funny, Professional, Serious, Tired of the Same Crap).
4. Content: I provide known information about the game for inclusion.
5. Optional: Sometimes, I throw in extra flair with commands like "Add Emojis!", "Go Over the Top!", or "Be Colorful!"

By using AI, I aim to bring you reviews that are both insightful and engaging. Thank you for understanding!

Zup S! is a minimalist puzzle game that proves simplicity can be incredibly enjoyable. With its clean, colorful visuals and straightforward mechanics, it's accessible to players of all ages and skill levels. The goal is to move shapes to their designated spots, which may sound easy but becomes increasingly challenging as you progress through levels. The game's intuitive design encourages experimentation and problem-solving.

Zup S! offers a perfect balance between casual entertainment and brain-teasing puzzles. It's a great choice for quick gaming sessions or unwinding after a long day. With its affordable price and no-frills approach, Zup S! is a delightful addition to any puzzle game enthusiast's library.

141379111.review: Zup! S is a game used for decorating your profile with neon letters, numbers, and symbols in a variety of colours. The way this is done is by giving you Steam Achievements which you can then use on a Achievement Showcase to write your name or whatever. If you don't like the style of these achievements, there are plenty more Zup! games in the series that each have a different style of achievements. Anyone who's interested in making their Steam profile look nice or boosting their total game or achievement count most likely has a Zup! game. The actual gameplay is a puzzle game standard to what you see on sites like CoolMathGames, however after each level (and clicking on a few things in the menu or hidden in levels), you get a couple of steam achievements. The puzzles are slightly interesting but not the main reason for people buying the game. The game normally costs $1 on sales so if you have a dollar and are interested in upgrading your steam profile, pick up a Zup! game.

2 tomates maduros sin piel y finamente picados (240 g)
1 sobre de CALDO CON COSTILLA MAGGI® DESMENUZADO (9 g)
3 tazas de agua (750 ml)
1/2 libra de fríjoles bola roja remojados desde la noche anterior (250 g)
1/4 libra de carne molida magra (125 g)
1/2 libra de arroz blanco cocinado (250 g)
1/4 de libra de tocino crocante cortado en 4 porciones (125 g)
4 chorizos tipo coctel previamente cocinados y dorados (120 g)
4 huevos fritos (200 g)
1 aguacate partido en 4 porciones (110 g)
4 arepas pequeñas redondas (80 g)
4 tajadas de plátano maduro fritas (80 g)

¡A cocinar!
PASO 1 Prepara los fríjoles

1.  Calienta en una olla a presión una cucharada de aceite por 3 minutos a fuego medio; añade la cebolla, el tomate y el sobre de CALDO CON COSTILLA MAGGI® DESMENUZADO y revuelve para integrar bien, finalmente cocina por 2 minutos o hasta que el tomate suelte sus jugos.
PASO 2 Agrega el agua

2.  Adiciona las tres tazas de agua y los fríjoles. Tapa la olla y cocina por 30 minutos.
PASO 3 Puntada final a los fríjoles

3.  Pasado el tiempo de cocción retira la olla del fuego, sácale el aire con cuidado antes de destapar. Vuelve nuevamente al fuego y cocina los fríjoles hasta que espesen. Debes continuar revolviendo de vez en cuando.
PASO 4 Prepara la carne molida

4.  Calienta en una sartén el aceite restante por 3 minutos a fuego medio. Agrega la carne y con una cuchara revuelve, debes dejar cocinar por 5 minutos o hasta que este bien cocinada.
PASO 5 Prepara los chicharrones

5.  En una olla de fondo alto agrega 2 tazas de agua y el tocino cortado en trozos; tapa la olla y lleva al fuego medio por 20 minutos o hasta que el tocino esté bien cocinado y crocante. Retira del fuego y déjalos en papel absorbente para retirar el exceso de grasa.
PASO 6 Prepara los chorizos

6.  En una sartén pequeña adicionar dos cucharadas de agua y los chorizos. Lleva a fuego medio hasta que los chorizos estén bien dorados.
PASO 7 Prepara las arepas

7.  En una parrilla o sartén a fuego medio debes poner las arepas y dorar por ambos lados.
PASO 8 Sirve

8.  En 4 bandejas o 4 platos sirve arroz, fríjoles, carne molida, chicharrón, chorizo, huevo, aguacate, arepa y 1 tajada de plátano maduro, todo en porciones iguales.

Lo diré claramente:
La gente que se ha comprado este juego solo para decorar su perfil, son incapaces de ver una obra de arte aunque la tengan delante de sus ojos.
Esta obra interactiva nos demuestra que un juego para farmear cromos o utilizar sus logros como decoración, puede ir mucho más allá. 
Me atrevo a decir que los mismísmos creadores de Elden Ring fueron los que crearon esta creencia popular de "es solo un juego para decorar el perfil de Steam", debido a que en el fondo, sabían que esta maravilla les iba a hacer competencia como nunca la habían tenido.
La jugabilidad es excelente, la música te atrapa, y nunca me había pasado de tener que comprarme dos cascos para seguir jugando porque el sonido que hacen los bloques rojos al estallar infligirían un daño dentro de los circuitos dejándolos inutilizables.

Este juego debería de ser obligatorio jugarlo para experimentar un verdardero juego de puzzle, no como otras m13rd4s que aún hay en esta plataforma.

Si no te ha gustado el juego, o sólo lo has usado para farmear, no tienes derecho a voz, voto, y cualquier cosa que incluya los derechos humanos básicos.

Recomiendo su compra, gracias.

135728613.review:
I just finished playing Zup! S and I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised by how much fun it was. The game is simple, but it's also incredibly addictive.

The premise is straightforward: you have to guide a little ball through a series of increasingly difficult levels, avoiding obstacles and collecting stars along the way. But what really sets Zup! S apart is the way the levels are designed.

Each level is like a puzzle, with different objects and platforms that you have to use in creative ways to get to the end. And the game is always introducing new mechanics and challenges, so you never get bored.

The graphics and music in Zup! S are also really well done. The visuals are bright and colorful, and the music is upbeat and catchy. It all adds up to a really fun and immersive experience.

One of the things I love most about Zup! S is how satisfying it is to complete a level. When you finally figure out the solution to a tricky puzzle, it feels like a real accomplishment.

Overall, I would definitely recommend Zup! S to anyone who enjoys puzzle games or just wants a fun and challenging experience. It's a great game that's sure to keep you entertained for hours.

And yes, I did play this game just for the letter achievements.

At Zup S, you get an exciting and challenging gaming experience. You control a little block-headed character that has to find its way through a variety of different levels, with enemies and obstacles to dodge along the way. You can earn points by completing levels and collecting items, which can be used to unlock new levels and worlds.

The game's controls are intuitive and the graphics are great, making it easy to navigate your way through the levels. The levels themselves are unique and complex, providing plenty of variety. There is plenty of replay value as you progress, with different approaches to completing each level.

The game also features a number of challenging puzzle-based levels, which are great fun and can really put your problem-solving skills to the test. With so many levels to choose from, there's something for everyone in Zup S.

Overall, Zup S is an exciting and fun game for all gamers, with plenty of challenge and replay value. It's a unique and innovative game that has a lot of charm and character, and is sure to provide hours of entertainment.

This is a review for all Zup games
Zup is an interesting puzzle game with many quick levels that, in my opinion, is known for 3 reasons:
- a lot of good looking achievements that you can use to customize your steam profile or for your gaming stats.
- most of the profile backgrounds from these games look nice and you have a good chance to find one that suits your profile theme; if you own the Zup game you can get the background from the steam points shop, otherwise you will have to be lucky when crafting a badge or just buy it.
- solving the levels is quite interesting if this is your type of game
So go ahead and try Zup! Price is also more than reasonable.

132331155.review:
No one cares about this review anyway so here is my favorite recipe:

Ingredients:
-1 quart buttermilk
-Kosher salt
-Pepper
-Two 3-pound whole chickens, cut into 8 pieces each
-3 cups all-purpose flour
-1 tablespoon hot paprika
-1 1/2 teaspoons onion powder
-1 1/2 teaspoons garlic powder
-48 ounces all-vegetable shortening or canola oil, for frying
-Hot sauce and assorted pickles, for serving

Directions
In a large bowl, whisk the buttermilk with 1 1/2 tablespoons of salt and 2 teaspoons of pepper. Add the chicken. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.

In another large bowl, whisk the flour, paprika, onion powder and garlic powder with 1 tablespoon of salt and 2 teaspoons of pepper. Spoon 1/4 cup of the buttermilk marinade into the dry ingredients and mix until the dry ingredients look slightly shaggy.

Remove 1 piece of chicken from the buttermilk, letting the excess drip back into the bowl. Dredge in the flour mixture, pressing to help it adhere. Transfer to a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining chicken pieces. Let stand for 30 minutes.

Line a large baking sheet with paper towels and set a rack on top. In a large saucepan, heat the shortening to 325°. Fry the chicken in batches at around 320°, turning occasionally, until golden and an instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest piece registers 160°, about 15 minutes. Transfer to the rack to drain. Let cool, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Serve with hot sauce and assorted pickles.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Zup!S is a casual arcade-style game that has gained popularity for its easy achievements system. The game is simple to play and offers 800 achievements for players to unlock, making it a popular choice among players looking to quickly boost their achievement count.

In Zup!S, players control a small ball that must navigate through a series of obstacles to reach the end of each level. The game's controls are intuitive and easy to pick up, making it accessible to players of all skill levels.

Despite its simplicity, Zup!S offers a decent level of challenge, with later levels requiring precise timing and quick reflexes to complete. However, it's the game's large number of achievements that is the real draw for many players.

From completing levels in a certain amount of time to performing specific actions, the 800 achievements in Zup!S offer a wide range of challenges for players to tackle. The achievements are easy to unlock and require relatively little time or effort, making them an attractive option for players looking to quickly increase their achievement count.

In conclusion, Zup!S is a fun and casual arcade-style game that is mostly used for its easy achievements system. While the game itself is enjoyable to play, it's the large number of achievements that is the real draw for many players. If you're looking for an easy way to boost your achievement count, then Zup!S is definitely worth checking out.

This is a very simple game that nonetheless has some interesting puzzles that might make you think for a little bit longer than you would even admit to yourself. There is a minimal about of repetitiveness per level which I can certainly appreciate. 

Something that I think might be unique to implement into future series of this game is for there to be the different strengths with which the objects are affected based on where you click the red objects.

At any rate, solid game that will occupy a good hour or so of your time. If this game is on sale or you happen to have a coupon for it, it is not a bad investment at all. Get ready for a lot of achievements at the completion of each level - and for your overall number to be padded.

121199493.review:
Hola maquinola termodinámica fusionadora de protones cósmicos, como andas? Yo bien.
Voy a proceder a contarte como funciona el mambo de estos jueguitos, porque claramente si no lo hago yo, no lo hace nadie.
Los Zup! están hechos para sacar cromos y/o logros para usar las letritas. En mi caso, me re chupa un huevo los logros y las letritas para el perfil, ya que el mio ya esta cheto flama 10/10. Por ende, lo compré por los cromos para farmear guita.
Te preguntarás: ¿Por qué?. Porque si los agarrás de oferta (9pe por ej), sacas profit de 1 a 3 pesos o inclusive más, porque hay cromos que se venden a 7 pesos.
Ahora paso a comentarte:
- Zup! X/S/F y todos los que tienen letras, son los que tienen cromo de valor de +4 pesos.
- Zup! 1 2 3 4 y todos esos, valen 2.50 o 3.50 como mucho.

En mi perfil tenes todos los que farmee hasta ahora, empecé con $9 y terminé en $56,11. Podría haber hecho más pero se me terminó la oferta. Esto es sencillo, es comprar y bajar Idle Master que te farmea solo los cromos.
¿Es legal? SI. Es totalmente legal, no te banean por eso. La única forma de comerte un ban, es que abras un juego con el anticheat de Valve. Por las dudas te recomiendo que mientras farmees cromos, no abras ni juegues nada.

Si te sirvió esta pelotudes que leíste, agradeceme puteandome en mi perfil como varios orangutanes lo hacen (Los cuales aprecio porque me agregan y me invitan a jugar y me ayudan a salir de mi depresión causada por la falta de contacto con otro ser humano causada por la cuarentena, o en su defecto, me putean y me hacen reír con su creatividad).

Un abrazo capo, espero que te haya servido. Si queres aprender a farmear cromos agregame y te explico

120198056.review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

119121164.review:
La vida de un crítico es sencilla en muchos aspectos. Arriesgamos poco y tenemos poder sobre aquellos que ofrecen su trabajo y su servicio a nuestro juicio. Preferimos las críticas negativas, que es divertida de escribir y de leer. Pero la triste verdad que debemos afrontar es que en el gran orden de las cosas, cualquier basura tiene más significado que lo que deja ver nuestra crítica.

Pero hay ocasiones en que el crítico realmente se arriesga, al descubrir y salir en defensa de algo nuevo. El mundo suele ser cruel con los nuevos talentos, las nuevas creaciones. Lo nuevo necesita amigos. Anoche experimenté algo nuevo, una extraordinario juego de una fuente singular e inesperada. Decir solo que el entretenimiento y su creador han desafiado mis prejuicios sobre la buena jugabilidad, subestimaría la realidad. Sacudieron los cimientos de mi mundo.

En el pasado, jamás oculté mi desdén por el famoso lema del Gabe Newell “Cualquiera puede jugar”, pero al fin me doy cuenta de lo que quiso decir en realidad: no cualquiera puede convertirse en un gran artista, pero un gran artista puede provenir de cualquier lado. Es difícil imaginar un origen más humilde que el del genio que creo esta obra, y quién, en opinión de este crítico, es nada menos que el mejor Creador de videojuegos que el gaming a podido tener.

117972766.review:
Con la boca pequeña lo recomiendo yo, es demasiado poco interactivo, demasiado pasivo y mi me aburrió un poco. Consta de 66 niveles y en cada uno de ellos tienes que llevar una bola azul a una plataforma verde para abrir la puerta y acceder a la siguiente fase pero, ¿cómo se hace? Pues haciendo click en los cuadrados y círculos rojos, al hacerlo explotan y mueven unas esferas amarillas que te permiten modificar cosas por el escenario para crear un camino a la pelota azul. Dicho así puede parecer interesante pero no, al final se reduce a hacer click en uno o pocos más botones rojos y esperar a que las carambolas funcionen, ya está. Muy pocos puzzles son mínimamente desafiantes, no es bonito, no es mucho en general. Lo voy a recomendar por ser muy barato, ser correcto y ser algo entretenido para mucha gente, para mí no lo fue.
La cuestión es que es el típico jueguecillo con cientos de logros (una logrorgía lo de este juego) y cromos que muchos quieren tener solo por eso, que sea bueno, chungo o terrible es lo de menos, en este sentido sí que es muy recomendable.
Bueno, cumple lo mínimo para no ser una pérdida de tiempo ni dinero pero es muy flojito, muy fácil y muy pasivo.

Nota: 5

116298077.review:
La premisa de este juego no puede ser más sencilla, tienes que lograr que la pelotita azul llegue a la zona verde y se mantenga allí. Para lograrlo lo único que tienes como recurso son los bloques o pelotas de color rojo (que como todo buen fan de los videojuegos debería saber, si es rojo, explota xDD). Jugando con las explosiones debes ingeniártelas para llegar a buen puerto, controlando el tiempo en el que decides explotar dichos bloques, viendo cómo se comportan las pelotas amarillas, accionando botones con ellas o incluso utilizando portales interconectados por el mapa. Los niveles que hay no es que sean muy complicados, pero si muy ingeniosos y alguno de la parte final te va a exigir un poco más de habilidad que el resto. Por lo demás es un juego entretenido y divertido, con el plus de que los logros de Steam te valen para decorar tu perfil poniendo el texto que prefieras en los colores que más te gusten :p

Si os gustan los puzzles sencillos e ingeniosos, este juego es una muy buena opción. ^^

115479272.review:
Like most people I bought this game for the achievements. The game can be 100% completed in about 30-45 minutes, and only needs to be ran for about 2-2.5 hours to snag all the free trading card drops. The game doesn't have a lot of replay value, but that's not really why most people are buying it anyways.

That said, the levels were decently well designed and fairly enjoyable to play through. The game doesn't really have a tutorial, so you'll find yourself learning by trial and error. This isn't much of a problem however, as even the hardest levels are fairly easy if you understand the mechanics, and could easily be brute forced even if you don't.

Overall, the game is decent enough, but if the achievements aren't the primary reason you're interested in the game you should probably spend your money on something else.

[h1][u]Introduction to Zup! S[/u][/h1]

Zup! S is a puzzle game in which you have to try to put a blue ball on a platform for three seconds and that will validate the level. Zup! S is the 12th installment of the Zup series developed by Quiet River, you will have a great time despite the long life span. 

[h1][u]Criteria[/u][/h1]

[b][u]Graphics/Design[/u][/b]

☐ Photorealism
☐ Beautiful
☑ Good
☐ Decent
☐ Bad
☐ Don't look too closely
☐ Paint.exe

The quality is not really there, but for this type of game, you don't need to have HD quality to enjoy the game.

[b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b]

☐ Very good
☑ Good
☐ Correct
☐ Looking at the walls is more interesting
☐ None

The game is intuitive and easy to pick up. For a puzzle game, that's cool!

[b][u]Audience[/u][/b]

☑ Children
☑ Teenagers
☑ Adults

This game is addressed for the whole family, whether you are a child, or a 65 year old man, this puzzle game is for you.

[b][u]PC configuration[/u][/b]

☐ Paint.exe
☑ Potato
☐ Decent
☐ Fast
☐ Son of a rich man
☐ NASA

No need for an RTX 3090 to run this game, rest assured! 

[b][u]Difficulty[/u][/b]

☐ Requires a bonobo equivalent brain
☑ Easy
☐ Use of brain recommended
☐ Easy to learn / Hard to master
☐ Difficult
☐ Dark Souls

The grip is really very simple, it's point and click. For the levels, the difficulty increases gradually.

[b][u]Grind[/u][/b]

☑ Nothing to grind
☐ Only if interested in ranks/ranking
☐ Not necessary for progression
☐ Average grind
☐ Too much grind
☐ You need a 2nd life

There is absolutely nothing to grind. All achievement badges are unlocked as you progress through the puzzles.

[b][u]Duration[/u][/b]

☐ Very long (+100h)
☐ Long (40-100h)
☐ Medium (25-40h)
☐ Short (8-25h)
☑ Very short (0-8h)

The game is short, only 1h to complete all levels.

[b][u]Price[/u][/b]

☐ Free!
☑ Good value for money
☐ Wait for a discount
☐ Not recommended

This game has a good value for money, for less than a euro you can have a great time.

[b][u]Bugs[/u][/b]

☑ Never heard of
☐ Minors
☐ Frustrating
☐ So many bugs, impossible to play

From my experience playing the game, I haven't noticed any bugs.

[h1][u]Conclusion[/u][/h1]

We won't hide it, the Zup! series is known for its number of hits (800 on the Zup! S), people tend to buy it to be able to customize their Steam profile. Nevertheless, the content is still interesting. For the base price, it's a good investment.

Colocar la carne en la mezcla anterior, dejar unos minutos, retirar y pasar por pan rallado.

Trying to alert the authorities.

  
I can autograph that.

  
A little gusty out there today,
wasn't it, comrades?

six miles from here tomorrow.

doing the same job every day?

  
Son, let me tell you about stirring.

move it around, and you stir it around.

  
You get yourself into a rhythm.

You know, Dad,
the more I think about it,

  
maybe the honey field
just isn't right for me.

  
You were thinking of what,
making balloon animals?

  
That's a bad job
for a guy with a stinger.

  
Janet, your son's not sure

- Barry, you are so funny sometimes.

You're not funny! You're going
into honey. Our son, the stirrer!

  
- You're gonna be a stirrer?
- No one's listening to me!

  
Wait till you see the sticks I have.

  
I could say anything right now.

Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.
Shave my antennae.

Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,

Wow!

Restroom attendant's open,
not for the reason you think.

102813294.review:
Zup! S is perfect if you're looking for a cheap game with letter achievements to spell out 7-character words on your steam profile. In just about 15 minutes, I completed all the levels required to get the letter Z. All levels after that give you numbers, keyboard symbols, and emojis, like a heart and flower. (There is also a secret thinking emoji on one of the levels that I thought was pretty funny. It is a red box near the bottom left of one of the letter levels.)

The gameplay is pretty simple and mostly plays itself. You click on the red-colored boxes/ spheres to make them explode and propel the yellow spheres into objects to help get the blue sphere into the end goal, opening the gate in the bottom right corner. As I said earlier, I completed just the letter portion of the game in around 15 minutes. You could likely do it faster.

TLDR; cheap, quick, and easy game for letter achievements to spell out words on steam profile.

94638898.review:
The author is rarely able to express his point of view succinctly, so the review may be a little lengthy. Or not.

So that there are no reservations and the like, I will say right away - in this game, achievements are at the forefront, and not the gameplay itself. As you may have noticed, for a long time there has been a tendency in Steam to make projects (it is often difficult to call it full-fledged games) with a minimum of gameplay and a maximum of achievements graph (up to 1000-2000 and more).

The Zup! slightly different. Firstly, this is a whole series of games designed for knocking out achievements for their subsequent use in showcases. Secondly, here, unlike the same BOOKS, there is still some kind of gameplay that can somehow captivate.
Let's see what advantages can be found in the game, which has 800 achievements, and why I can still recommend it.


"Technical part"

I apologize in advance, but I will sometimes compare Zup! S with BOOKS, since these are games of the same category, if not genre, and their price is the same. In addition, they simply would never have been born if it had not been in the Achievement incentive (or if there were restrictions on a couple of hundred achievements).

So, as far as the technical part is concerned, everything is fine with the monitored project. The game does not lag, no bugs were noticed, as well as broken achievements.

Originally posted by Benjamin Franklin
Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.

"Achievements"

As you might expect, the plot is completely absent here, so let's talk about achievements instead. In every part of the Zup! Achievement badges are represented by letters, numbers and special symbols, made in different styles. The number of achievements can vary from hundreds to a couple of thousand. In this part, the achievement badges are made in a peculiar neon style, and for each level you can get 10 achievements - one for starting a level and another 9 for completing it.

There are a lot of levels in the game (66 to be precise), and each is associated with a certain symbol, be it an alphabet letter, a number, or some special sign, therefore, we get achievements for this level with a corresponding icon. There are also achievements related to the game menu, which can be obtained for clicks on various items and design.


"Gameplay"

So, the game is designed to knock out achievements and use them in the showcase. We have already found this out. But what about the gameplay itself? In general, can it be played as a game and how interesting is it? As it turned out, in terms of gameplay, this is far from the worst project. The game consists of a certain number of levels, each of which, in turn, consists of square blocks, yellow balls, switches and one blue ball. The ultimate goal at each level is to make the blue ball hit a special green field and thus open the door to the next level.

At the same time, the only objects with which the player can interact at the level are red blocks and balls, clicking on which undermines them and scatters objects that are next to them. It doesn't sound very difficult, in fact, the first few levels are a kind of warm-up, where all you have to do is click on the red block or ball and watch how the yellow balls, moving along ingenious trajectories, push the blue ball towards the final goal.

But it is only at the beginning that everything seems simple and looks as if the game is playing in itself. Then the levels will become more difficult, there are more and more objects for interaction, you need to take into account the order of detonation, and sometimes choose the exact moment in order to direct the next yellow ball in the right direction. With all this, it is noticeable that the one who designed the levels for this game really tried and the elaboration of the sequences of movement of objects at individual levels is really impressive.

Despite the large number of levels and the complexity of some of them, the game is played fairly quickly - in two to three hours, and can serve as a good rest from work or other games, however, it will not be enough for more than a couple of evenings.

Originally posted by Harold Taylor
The roots of true achievement lie in the will to become the best that you can become.

"Audiovisual"

The graphics in the game are quite minimalistic and primitive. There are only basic colors, simple geometry of levels and objects on them, but, at the same time, the visual style of the game is really memorable.

The soundtrack in the game is either completely absent, or one song is playing there, which I did not remember at all. Sounds to match the design - simple and few of them.

Zup! S is:
Achievements, thousands of them!
Conveyor.
Few mindfulness tasks
Opportunity to write in your showcase of achievements "ZUP"
Tons of yellow balls and one blue ball.
A bit of neon for the profile
The ability to buy 800 achievements for almost nothing
Stonks!!!

     Es muß denn das Schwert entscheiden! Mitten im Frieden überfällt uns der Freind. Darum auf! Zu den Waffen! Jedes Schwanken, jedes Zögern wäre Verrat am Vaterlande.

     Um Sein oder Nichtsein unseres Reiches handelt es sich, das unsere Väter sich neu gründeten. Um Sein oder Nichtsein deutscher Macht und deutschen Wesens.

     Wir werden uns wehren bis zum letzten Hauch von Mann und Roß. Und wir werden diesen Kampf bestehen auch gegen eine Welt von Feinden. Noch nie ward Deutschland überwunden, wenn es einig war.

     Vorwärts mit Gott, der mit uns sein wird, wie er mit den Vätern war!
